Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we have similar tech but focus on slightly different things, I would say

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> I see it on Twitter

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I have been involved with Pirate since the day it started

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> but I remember reading about something on Hush and metadata, is that a feature that ARRR also has, or it's unique to Hush?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is a much older project

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> OK, I've also been following ARRR from the beginning

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush+Pirate use about 90% of the same code. Both have Sapling shielded transactions. Pirate enforces them, while Hush still allows old non-private stuff. Hush has smart contracts, while Pirate does not, since they are not currently compatible with zaddrs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> ah...ok...didn't realise Hush had smart contracts

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Pirate is more focused on financial privacy and Hush is more focused on communication privacy. The very internals are very similar, but the layers in the middle and the top (the GUIs/etc) is where they different. And their supply curves/etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> We just added smart contracts to Hush in April with our new mainnet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we haven't really marketed that much yet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> OK now I understand better

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> and the messenger is still being built I think, not ready yet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we have KMD-style cryptoconditions (which are now rebranded to Antara Modules, i think)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @D2D by "messenger" you mean SilentDragon, we have windows binaries and source release here: https://github.com/MyHush/SilentDragon/releases

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it does have the beginnings of "messenger-like functionality", but the UI is still being worked on. You can send me a message via "Help -> Send Duke Feedback", or send a random person a text message up to 512 bytes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> "not ready yet" is a perpetual state in cryptocoins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Everything is always being worked on

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> Yes that's how it's also called on your site:, says: "Private Cryptocurrency and Messenger on Zero Knowledge Proof Encryption"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> OK so it's basically at a good stage

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> In the future hopefully on app stores too

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> --

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> I asked this question also on Komodo today...if someone launches a blockchain on Komodo, you have all the features you need and it's great, but I don't think there is an infrastructure similar to Ethereum, with wallets like Metamask, for dapps. Or maybe there is?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @D2D there is, but web-based wallets like Metamask don't exist in Bitcoin world, because mostly people don't think they are safe. I surely don't

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Never ever trust your private keys to a browser.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> KMD does have many GUI mobile + desktop wallets that support asset chains, explorers, many things

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> OK

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @D2D I don't mean to be mean, but KMD tech actually works. I haven' seen ETH tech that people use, but I know very little about ETH world

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> I think KMD is safer, more scalable and private, so it's better

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ETH was the best thing to make non-mineable tokens for a few minutes, but that is not a feature that should make it worth anything now. A bajillion projects, including KMD, can do that for you, cheaper and better

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> And KMD doesn't tax you for every transaction on your chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ETH gas/etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> but it's hard to create something that uses the coins I think

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> Ethereum has a lot for that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://composer.kmd.io/ changes a lot

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> They are not great, I mean Metamask is clunky

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's directly competing with ETH, to make things easier

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> There was no GUI to make HUSH, it's way beyond the scope of a GUI builder like that. It's got a lot of custom stuff. But that GUI chain builder enables so many people to make custom KMD chains, with no CLI requirements.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> Yes I mean that is fantastic, I saw it today

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> (Composer)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> This is why Hush transitioned from our own custom codebase to a KMD-based codebase

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> ok

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and various other reasons

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> also, since I am a KMD dev, I wrote a lot of code that went into Hush + KMD. Using KMD meant I only had to write half as much code ðŸ˜…

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> But Ethereum I think is ahead for building dapps, just in terms of infrastructure

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's falling apart

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> !ticker eth

Content:

https://console.atra.io/

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is not interested in competing against ETH. KMD is doing that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> OK

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> But we do have smart contracts

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> I'm asking because I think Komodo has better security, privacy and scalability

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <D2D> (than Ethereum)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @D2D http://cryptoconditions.info/

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we have a few of those contracts enabled, and basically, you can make an instance of a contract with your own addresses/etc
